Class Medium

  • java.lang.Object
    • Medium

  • class Medium
extends java.lang.Object
     The class represents wireless medium.
 Main components: 
 - a list of transmissions in the air
 - noise levels as seen by particular nodes
 - path losses between each pair of nodes (Transmission power - Path Loss = Receiving power)

    • Field Detail

      • BACKGROUND_NOISE

        static final float BACKGROUND_NOISE
        if there are no transmissions in the air, the noise equals the value.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SYNC_TIME

        static final float SYNC_TIME
        constant time of synchronization phase TODO: is it realistic ?
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • currentTransmissions

        static java.util.ArrayList<Transmission> currentTransmissions
        Transmissions in the air

      • globalNoiseLvl

        static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Float> globalNoiseLvl
        List of noise lvls (for all nodes). 
Values in the list are calculated with taking into account, that node synced reception and a transmission that node transmit is NOT a noise from the node perspective.

      • Pld0_Pt

        static final float Pld0_Pt
        Path loss propagation model - From the document: Yet Another Network Simulator (auth. Lacage, Henderson), chapter 8.1 Pl(d)=Pl(d0)+n*10*log_10(d/d0) Pl(d0)=Pt*Gt*Gr*lambda^2/(16*pi^2*d0^2*L) I will take values like in the document - if you want ot adjust transmission gains and so on - feel free ! for 2.4GHz: lambda=v/f, v=3*10^8 m/s, f=2.4*10^9 Hz, lambda=0.125 m That part is constant: Pl(d0)/Pt=Gt*Gr*lambda^2/(16*pi^2*d0^2*L)

      • distancePowerDecreaseMatrix

        private static float[][] distancePowerDecreaseMatrix
        Matrix of transmission power decrease due to distance between nodes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Medium

        Medium()
        Constructor. Initializes power decrease matrix on the basis of nodes distances, also sets background noise to global noise lvl.

    • Method Detail

      • addCurrentTransmission

        static void addCurrentTransmission(Transmission t)
        When a node starts a transmission, the function is called. It adds the transmission to the list of current transmissions and updates global noise lvls.
        Parameters:
        t - transmission
        See Also:
        Node.tryToStartTransmission()

      • removeCurrentTransmission

        static void removeCurrentTransmission(Transmission t)
        find the transmission t in the list of current transmissions and remove it from the list. Then, update noise lvls.
        Parameters:
        t - the transmission

      • fillDistancePowerDecreaseMatrix

        private void fillDistancePowerDecreaseMatrix()

      • getDistancePowerDecrease

        private static float getDistancePowerDecrease(Position pos1,
                                              Position pos2)
         Path loss propagation model - From the document: Yet Another Network Simulator (auth. Lacage, Henderson), chapter 8.1
 Pl(d)=Pl(d0)+n*10*log_10(d/d0)
 
 The function calculates this part: n*10*log_10(d/d0)
 n=3 - From the document: Yet Another Network Simulator (auth. Lacage, Henderson), chapter 8.1
